meanings.definition: A person abandoned by society or their family
meanings.sent1: The kind-hearted woman always helped the derelicts she met on the street.
meanings.sent2: The city shelter provided a warm meal for the derelicts who had nowhere else to go.
meanings.sent3: The derelicts in the park were surprised when a magician suddenly appeared and offered them free tickets to his show.
meanings.sent4: The derelicts of society are like forgotten puzzle pieces, waiting to be found and valued.
meanings.sent5: The image of the derelicts huddled around the fire pit will forever stay in my memory.

meanings.sent1: The old pirate tale spoke of a haunted ship filled with derelicts doomed to sail the seas forever.
meanings.sent2: The sailors spotted a derelict drifting aimlessly in the distance, its sails torn and tattered.
meanings.sent3: The crew joked that the derelict ship was actually a secret base for sea monsters.
meanings.sent4: The derelict ship stood as a ghostly reminder of the dangers that lurked in the open waters.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the derelict ship disappearing into the mist sent shivers down their spines.

meanings.sent1: The neighborhood was filled with derelict buildings that once thrived with life.
meanings.sent2: The derelict factory stood as a silent witness to the town's industrial past.
meanings.sent3: Local kids often played hide-and-seek in the derelict mansion, imagining it was haunted.
meanings.sent4: The derelict property was a stark reminder of the economic downturn the town had faced.
meanings.sent5: The overgrown garden of the derelict house whispered tales of its former glory.
